bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to John J. Moran, September 12, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison invites Moran to the Lazear memorial dedication and offers to pay his expenses.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to John J. Moran, September 12, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
September 12, 1940

div1.p:
This letter is to confirm our previous letter
inviting you to come for the dedication of the Lazear
Chemistry Building and for the exercises of that week-
end. The play Yellow Jack will be given by the students
on Friday night, October twenty-fifth, and the building
will be dedicated on Saturday the twenty-sixth. Doctor
Hench will speak at the dinner on Saturday evening and
we want you here for the whole program.

As indicated previously, this College will pay
your own personal expenses. We are also inviting Mr.
Kissinger and it will make another reunion for you and
him. I hope very much that you can come and it would
be a great pleasure to us to welcome Mrs. Moran if she
could come with you.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Ralph Cooper Hutchison Mr. John J. Moran
